title: Domain 5.6: Given a scenario, troubleshoot and resolve printer issues.
content:
ğŸ–¨ï¸ 5.6 â€“ Common Printer Issues

ğŸ“„ Lines Down the Printed Pages

Usually caused by dirty rollers or a damaged imaging drum.

ğŸ”£ Garbled Print

Often the result of incorrect printer drivers or corrupted print data.

ğŸ”¥ Toner Not Fusing to Paper

Toner rubs off easily â€” likely due to a failing fuser assembly.

ğŸš«ğŸ“„ Paper Jams

Caused by misfed or wrinkled paper, dirty rollers, or incorrect paper size.

ğŸŒ«ï¸ Faded Print

Could be due to low toner, clogged ink nozzles, or eco-mode settings.

ğŸ“ Incorrect Paper Size

Mismatch between tray settings and driver configuration.

More Common Printer Issues

ğŸš«ğŸ“„ Paper Not Feeding

Worn or dirty rollers may not grip paper properly.

ğŸ“š Multipage Misfeed

Humidity or worn separator pads may cause multiple sheets to feed at once.

ğŸ•“ğŸ–¶ Multiple Prints Pending in Queue

Driver/software glitches or temporary connection issues.

âš«ğŸ”² Speckling on Printed Pages

Often from leaking toner cartridges or drum contamination.

ğŸª Double/Echo Images

Drum or fuser unit may not be functioning properly.

ğŸ¨ Incorrect Color Settings

Mismatch between software, printer driver, and printer profile.

ğŸ› ï¸ Grinding Noise

Likely a mechanical issue â€” gears, rollers, or obstructions inside the printer.

Finishing Issues

ğŸ“ Staple Jams

Stapler unit may be jammed or misaligned in the finishing unit.

ğŸ•³ï¸ Hole Punch Problems

Punch unit can misfeed if output tray is overloaded or improperly aligned.

â†•ï¸ Incorrect Page Orientation

Mismatch between app print settings and printer layout (portrait vs landscape).
